intro: Adenophyllum glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular adenophyllum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
